content.question: Mighty Cable Company manufactures cable that sells for $120 per meter. For a cable of fixed length, the cost of producing a portion of the cable varies with its distance from the beginning of the cable. Mighty reports that the cost to produce a portion of a cable that is x meters from the beginning of the cable is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>6</mn> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@380C@</annotation> </semantics> </math> dollars per meter. (Note: Profit is defined to be the difference between the amount of money received by the company for selling the cable and the company's cost of producing the cable.) (a) Find Mighty’s profit on the sale of a 25-meter cable.

frqParts.text: Mighty Cable Company manufactures cable that sells for $120 per meter. For a cable of fixed length, the cost of producing a portion of the cable varies with its distance from the beginning of the cable. Mighty reports that the cost to produce a portion of a cable that is x meters from the beginning of the cable is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>6</mn> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@380C@</annotation> </semantics> </math> dollars per meter. (Note: Profit is defined to be the difference between the amount of money received by the company for selling the cable and the company's cost of producing the cable.) (a) Find Mighty’s profit on the sale of a 25-meter cable.

(b) Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mn>25</mn></mrow> <mrow> <mn>30</mn></mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mn>6</mn><msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaa8qmaeaaca aI2aWaaOaaaeaacaWG4baaleqaaaqaaiaaikdacaaI1aaabaGaaG4m aiaaicdaa0Gaey4kIipakiaabccacaWGKbGaamiEaaaa@3F72@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> in the context of this problem.
(c) Write an expression, involving an integral, that represents Mighty's profit on the sale of a cable that is k meters long.
(d) Find the maximum profit that Mighty could earn on the sale of one cable. Justify your answer.

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
